content: mini eggy ghost - crochet pattern by dreamweave creations introduction introducing the mini eggy ghost your go-to no-sew crochet pattern for creating an adorably spooky emoji inspired ghost this delightful design is perfect for crochet enthusiasts of all skill levels offering a quick and easy way to craft a small charming ghost with its simple shape and endless possibilities for funny embroidered faces the mini eggy ghost is sure to bring a smile to anyone s face whether you re looking to make a unique plush keyring or a cute halloween decoration for your home this pattern provides all the instructions you need to create a whimsical ghost that s both fun and adorable the pattern starts at the top of the head and works down incorporating the arms using bobble stitch the skirt is crocheted directly onto the body a little simple embroidery is required for the face i ve provided options for either safety eyes or embroidered eyes using dk yarn and a 2 5mm hook eggy ghost reaches a height of approximately 6cm i d love to see your completed projects feel free to share them by tagging me on instagram @dreamweave creations or visiting my facebook page dreamweave creations skill level beginner - i have assigned a beginner skill level to this pattern while it primarily involves simple stitches a bit of embroidery is also required you must be familiar with reading patterns and understanding the abbreviations and terminology additionally you should be comfortable working into the back loop and front loop only materials chosen yarn in desired colours the following yarns in dk weight have been used in the pattern 👻 white for body and skirt you will also need the following embroidery thread or yarn - i used 6 strands of embroidery thread 👻 tiny amount of black for embroidering mouth and eyes if opting for embroidered eyes 👻 tiny amount of red for embroidering tongue safety eyes if not opting for embroidered eyes the number and size depend on the face you are making refer to the photographs in the face section for inspiration toy stuffing 2 5mm crochet hook scissors pins stitch markers tapestry needle notes and tips tight stitching keep your stitches tight to avoid stuffing showing through if needed switch to a smaller hook size to achieve a snug finish i also prefer to use the yarn under technique see link stitch marker placement use stitch markers to keep track of the beginning of each round this is crucial especially in pieces with continuous rounds stuffing consistency ensure even firm stuffing for a well-shaped amigurumi use small amounts of stuffing at a time and distribute it evenly as you go variations feel free to explore variations by swapping out yarn and hook sizes to achieve a different outcome and get creative by experimenting with various colours continuous rounds crochet in continuous rounds without slip stitching to join unless specified otherwise this creates a smoother and seamless appearance abbreviations this pattern
